text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- "Terrorists" kill 22 people in a village near Medea, 70 km (45 miles) south of Algiers on Thursday night. Among the dead were women and children and a whole family of nine. "Terrorists" cut the throats of six peasants on Wednesday night in Tipaza, west of Algiers.
- Air Algerie launches tenders to lease nine planes.
- Club Sportif of Constantine wins Algeria's soccer championship.
- Fifth anniversary of the murder of president Mohamed Boudiaf.
- President Liamine Zeroual proposes October 2 as a tentative date for the local elections.
- Three political parties form a coalition government to implement one programme.
- Zeroual proposes October 2 as date for the local poll but the National Liberation Front favours November instead.
